s.text: And the state can exhume a body when it deems a death suspicious and improperly investigated.

And the state can exhume a body when it deems a death suspicious and improperly investigated.
And the state can exhume a body when it deems a death suspicious and improperly investigated.
Both Jews and Muslims take nearly as strong positions against disinterment.
Some Native American tribes assert the body's spirit lives on and that to disturb a corpse is to disturb the spirit's life.
Exhumation is allowed only when a body is to be reburied with family or in Israel.
Generally, citizens can apply to their state's attorney general for permission to exhume family members for any reason, and requests for reburial are usually automatically granted.
Other new techniques include the use of computer animation to construct images of faces, based on surviving jawbones and teeth, as well as information gleaned from DNA about hair color.
Here are the most common reasons for exhumation : DNA extractions to settle paternity suits; criminal investigations; relocation to familial cemetery plots; and accidental discoveries--e.g.
Other new techniques include the use of computer animation to construct images of faces, based on surviving jawbones and teeth, as well as information gleaned from DNA about hair color.

In Eastern Europe, exhumed bodies have been used as symbols by political parties, as anthropologist Katherine Verdery explains in her forthcoming book, The Political Lives of Dead Bodies in the Postsocialist Transformation . For instance, liberal reform parties have disinterred Communist leaders from their mausoleums while reburying pre-Communist nationalist heroes in elaborate sarcophagi.
